contentrichtext.text: {{infobox UK place |country = England |static_image_name = St. Nicholas, Newnham, Hampshire - geograph.org.uk - 1719280.jpg |static_image_caption = St Nicholas, Newnham |latitude = 51.2799 |longitude = -0.9893 |official_name = Newnham |population = 513 |Civil_parish = Newnham |shire_district = |shire_county = [[Hampshire]] |region = South East England |constituency_westminster = |post_town = |postcode_district = |postcode_area = |dial_code = |os_grid_reference = SU7059153907 }}'''Newnham''' is a [[village]] and [[Civil parish (England)|parish]] in [[Hampshire]], [[England]]. It is situated {{convert|4|mi}} east of [[Basingstoke]], and {{convert|1|mi}} west of [[Hook, north Hampshire|Hook]]. At the [[United Kingdom Census 2001|2001 census]] it had a population of 513. ==Location== '''Position:''' {{gbmapping|SU705540}} ==Local government== Newnham is a civil parish with an elected parish council. Newnham parish falls within the area of [[Basingstoke and Deane|Basingstoke and Deane District Council]] and of [[Hampshire|Hampshire County Council]] and all three councils are responsible for different aspects of local government. ==See also== *[[List of places in Hampshire]] *[[List of civil parishes in England]] ==External links== {{Commons category inline|Newnham, Hampshire}} [[Category:Villages in Hampshire|Newnham]] {{Hampshire-geo-stub}} {{Basingstoke and Deane}}
